overview:
David Razavi is the Chief Executive Officer and Founder for Bouju, the technology leader in enterprise brand and reputation protection. Bouju has developed entirely innovative solutions to solve premier brandsâ€™ challenges fighting counterfeiters

Prior to Bouju, David was the CTO at Onestop Internet with extensive experience managing ecommerce and technology platform for 40+ marquee brands. He was VP of Technology at Traffic Marketplace, where he built the big data technology infrastructure for the digital marketing solutions provider, leading to its $100 million merger with Epic Media. Before Traffic Marketplace, David served as Executive VP of Engineering at LowerMyBills for four years, from the startup phase to its acquisition by Experian for $385 million. David built the comparison shopping platform for home loans, education, credit cards, and insurance among other businesses, and headed the product development, management and web operations.

Earlier, Mr. Razavi held management positions at IAC/InterActive Corp (LendingTree), RealNames, and technical positions at Veritas (NetLabs), Bay Networks (SynOptics) and TCSI (Teknekron)

Mr. Razavi is a subject expert and conference speaker on e-commerce and e-marketing technologies. He is on the technical advisory boards of several startups funded by Greylock and Accel Partners.
